Message.Title: Sybs has never witnessed or studied a period in the markets where
Message.Msg: stox were so hated while trading at all time markey highz.... Look at any stok board out and you'll find the following overwhelming sentiment of disdain and mistrust az it relates particularly to the financial markets while they were at all time highs... Any board - just look at the hate.... It waz not like that in the tulip bubble, in 1929, in 1963, in 1998-2000, or even in 1 2005-2008 all love love love... Now sybil iz not saying that the markets were never hated so much.... In 1932 - 1937: hate; dot bomb + an enron kicker = 2003 hate..... What sybil iz saying iz that when stox are low they are hated, when stox are high they are loved.... But here stox and finance are high AND hated.... At no point in history has this ever ever existed. We are either going to break out on hate to MONSTER new all time highs until such a time stox are universally loved - 1700+ on the s&p would be that level, or the stok markets are going to CRASH to levelz that match the hate..... 450 on the s&p would be that level. A very interesting paradox that bernanke haz created.

Topic.Title: amzn getting sue omg the scam is done

Message.Msg: Not remotely true. This puts Amazon on anti-trust defense (Germany has been asked to review 3P T&C as anti-competitive). This is JUST THE START. Importantly, this will lay the foundation for iBooks and Google Books match to eliminate Amazon's installed base advantage in eBooks, which will make Amazon's key franchise far more vulnerable. Once the industry goes to EPUB format, Amazon loses its lock-in effect.

Topic.Title: amzn getting sue omg the scam is done

Message.Msg: But, if they were made extinct by anti-competitive practices by Amazon... More importantly, DOJ is wrong footed on the anti-trust cases related to AAPL and AMZN and this will clarify the mistake. Can you say mandatory EPUB portability for all AMZN Kindle Books? That is what is coming...

Topic.Title: amzn getting sue omg the scam is done

Message.Msg: so there is competing opinions - as far as 3P sales not sure how that is anticompetitive? Kinda like saying Ebay can't use a buy it now listing from an online re-seller. Oh, and what about AMZN patent to re-sell used ebooks? This recent suit by the independents is their last stand to try and avoid extinction. In the end it will be Apple and AMZN for all music/book digital content. Will there be lawsuits, sure . . . but they will be settled . . .

Topic.Title: The Forward PE Forcasts are Hogwash

Message.Msg: I'm assuming you think the forecasts won't be met. If it's like what we just saw with this past Q with weak guidance I would agree. I think their growth is slowing and there are headwinds between the state taxes and price matching all over the place.

Topic.Title: amzn getting sue omg the scam is done

Message.Msg: In terms of 3P, it is the most favored nation pricing restrictions. Amazon is restricting sellers fro offering lower prices outside of Amazon as I read it. Should be interesting. Given all the hype that Amazon has won online commerce and 3P, it may have some real trouble there. Certainly isn't going to help Amazon's brand in Europe, which is already under assault from the working conditions fiasco. In terms of reselling books, I'd have to do some searching, but patents are a negative right and not a positive right. I would be surprised if there wasn't any related IP upon which it would depend. Thus, Amazon could be excluded by someone holding IP necessary to execute said transaction... in the end, it will likely be a FRAND type framework (and publishers will change the T&C of future books to limit to 1 or maybe 2 owners, making the point moot for all new books...).

Message.Title: The tranquil life of a PPS-289-AMZN short
Message.Msg: Not an iota of a worry friends here ... as some one who shorted AMZN at 289 after hours in the fake-runup post earnings ... sleep like a baby ... will wake up a few weeks from now, and cover the first lot at 180 ... let the rest ride down... will wake-up towards the end of the year and cover some around $120 ... and let the rest glide-down for a few more months/years ... will cover it all around $41! The moral of the story is: When you do your homework thoroughly, you can sleep like a baby, whether long or short a particular equity! [No micro-second pps checking for me on this almost-certified-Tulip! LoL! :-) ].

Message.Title: Sales Tax impact on Amazon
Message.Msg: Interesting article. Assumes that Amazon has a 75% share of online retail in CA. With CA collecting $89 million in taxes it suggests that sales are about 7.5% of Amazon sales. Even though CA has 11% of US wealth. The article suggests that sales tax is having an impact in CA. I think he is wrong, because I still shop on Amazon. I still worry more about shipping charges over sales tax. http://seekingalpha.com/article/1207531-california-sales-tax-receipts-show-sales-tax-collection-impact?source=yahoo

Message.Title: Amazon is CANCER, destroying 10000s jobs and not paying taxes
Message.Msg: This company has to die! We don't accept companies, who do not share the values in our culture, who treat workers inhuman and don't pay taxes.

Topic.Title: Sales Tax impact on Amazon

Message.Msg: The underlying economics depend upon the value density. Tax has a much bigger impact on large ticket items than low value items. Shipping has a much bigger impact on low value density items. Wait until calpers gets active here and forces Amazon to collect on FBA as well... Lots more Prime members now. Despite mental midget analysts treating Prime as such, it isn't equivalent to costco's membership stream which has no incremental cost and a well designed and effective selection bias. This will prove to be much more of an achilles heel than anyone understands today...

Topic.Title: AMZN trading alert

Message.Msg: The signal was generated before the trade time indicated in the alert statement. The signals can show up (rarely) before regular market open, (rarely) during regular trading hours, or (mostly) before regular market close.

Topic.Title: if this stock is so good, why insiders selling likes no tomorrow?

Message.Msg: The narrative on this company is about to change big time (German working conditions and 3P anti-trust inquiry, US Indy anti-trust case... Very little of Amazon's market cap is tangible or can be explained by cash flows. The brand damage will be significant before all this is done (especially when amazon has to alter customer/vendor T&C before the end of 2013...).
